title: Nothing compares....NOTHING
comment: I am all about robust dual pane file management, I have been for many years. I have used literally every file manager available for Android, and I can honestly say that nothing else compares to this file manager. It has everything you would ever want or need in a file manager, and then some. This application actually rivals the Windows based dual pane file managers that I use on the PC. I have been trying (really trying) to find flaws or something missing that I would need, but it is extremely difficult :) The one and only thing I would say needs improvement is the listing of mounted external SD media. I have like 13 of them listed due to the fact that I have other apps in the OS mounting folders for other purposes (like GL to SD mounting game folders) and they are detected. Maybe a way to hide these would be a good idea. Really all I could thing of honestly. GREAT JOB!! A must for Android TV box users like myself with large hard drives to manipulate. THANK YOU for this!

title: AWESOME
comment: First, people who say you hve to manually type destinations to move/copy files just do not know how to do it.  You have two tabs on top (left and right) click on what file you want in either (lets say, the left for example) hit "move/copy/whatever" then click on the other tab ontop (lets say the right) then go to where you want to put the file and hit "paste"  THAT SIMPLE PEOPLE!!!!  I have an Asus eepad slider and without this I had to email myself pdfs I wanted to read from my laptop, then download them on my tablet.  NOW (since I have a usb drive) I can just plug in my portable hard drive and move/copy whatever files onto my eepad wherever I want!  So do not even need an internet connection NOR keep the hard drive plugged in (which can be uncomfortable when reading on the couch or something).  So this file manager is really really AWESOME!  Perfect for anyone who uses their mobile technology for research or work.
